Sentence.sentence: But a university degree unaccompanied by a gain in knowledge or skills is an empty achievement indeed.

Sentence.sentence: Indeed many organizations also useinstitutional or prestige advertising which is designed to build uptheir reputation rather than to sell particular products.

Sentence.sentence: Barrett wanted to find out if the absence of physical currency does indeed cause a person to spend more, so she decided to conduct an experiment a few months ago.

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, nowadays most people like to listen to pop and rock music.

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, our schools and universities are structured to mould pupils to be mostly obedient servants of rationality, and to develop outdated skills in interacting with outdated machines.

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, sea ice cover in the Arctic is melting faster than expected.

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, when the expert pays attention to the mechanics, it is liable to disrupt performance.

Sentence.sentence: One of the things that businesses and indeed government organizations often fail to do is to really see what is happening from the consumer's perspective.

Sentence.sentence: Personal technology is indeed more engaging than ever, and there's no doubt companies are engineering their products and services to be more compelling and attractive.

Sentence.sentence: Printing indeed played a key role in standardizing and stabilizing these languages by fixing them in print, and producing dictionaries and grammar books.

Sentence.sentence: Twenge and her colleagues also found that across the key years of 2013-16, well-being was indeed lowest in years where adolescents spent more time online, on social media, and reading news online, and when more youth in the United States had smartphones.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些副词均有"确实地，真正地"之意。
means: indeed ： 一般用于肯定或证实对方所说的话，多承接前言，也用来加强或肯定自己说话的语气。
really ： 主要用于强调与事实或现实不相违背，也可表示不快、惊奇或某种含蓄的怀疑。
truly ： 强调客观存在的真实性，没有任何虚假。
actually ： 侧重于实际的事，而不是凭空想象或推测的事。

stems_affixes.word_buile: in使……+deed做,行为→使……做→成为现实

data.mean: （用于very和形容词或副词之后，强调叙述、描写等）真正地

sentence.en: A friend in need is a friend indeed.
sentence.from: 2016年高考英语北京卷 阅读理解 阅读B 选项

mean.mean: （用于very和形容词或副词之后，强调叙述、描写等）真正地

expand_knowledge_list.en: 1.a friend in need is a friend indeed

entry.def: You use indeed to confirm or agree with something that has just been said.

example.ex: Later, he admitted that the payments had indeed been made...
example.tran: 后来,他承认确实付过款了。

example.ex: He did indeed keep important documents inside his hat...
example.tran: 他确实把重要文件放在了他的帽子里。

entry.def: You use indeed to introduce a further comment or statement which strengthens the point you have already made.
entry.tran: (表示语气的递进)实际上,其实,确切说来

example.ex: We have nothing against diversity; indeed, we want more of it...
example.tran: 我们一点都不抵触多样化;实际上,我们需要多样性更丰富一些。

example.ex: When we asked to see more we were refused. Indeed we were escorted away by men with guns.
example.tran: 当我们要求进一步参观时却被拒绝了。实际上，我们是被一些带枪的人护送离开的。

entry.def: You use indeed at the end of a clause to give extra force to the word 'very', or to emphasize a particular word.
entry.tran: (位于句末修饰very或强调某词)确实,实在

example.ex: The engine began to sound very loud indeed...
example.tran: 发动机开始发出极大的声响。

example.ex: The wine was very good indeed...

entry.def: You can use indeed as a way of repeating a question in order to emphasize it, especially when you do not know the answer.
entry.tran: (重复问题以作强调,尤用于答案未知时)到底,究竟

example.ex: 'Now where are the real villains?' — 'Where indeed?'...
example.tran: “那么那些真正的恶棍在哪里？”——“是啊，到底在哪里？”

example.ex: 'And what do we do here?' — 'What, indeed?'
example.tran: “我们在这里做什么呢?”——“是啊，到底做什么?”

sentences.sentence: "they said the car would break down and indeed it did"

means.word_mean: 2. (used as an interjection) an expression of surprise or skepticism or irony etc.;

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: originally as in deed

sentences.cn: 甚至可以说, 列举出任何性交合体位的清单并清晰地做出定义也许根本就是不明智的.
sentences.en: Indeed, it is perhaps unwise to list any distinct and clearly defined coital positions all.

sentences.cn: 诚然, 现在使他们走到一起的利益之土孕育著未来竞争 、 甚至是冲突的种子.
sentences.en: Indeed , the interests now drawing them together contain the seeds of future competition, even conflict.

sentences.cn: 尤其值得注意的是, 他们甚至也杀害穆斯林.
sentences.en: Indeed, above all, they have murdered Muslims.

sentences.cn: 他是个非常好的人, 我甚至可以说, 他是我所知道的最有勇气的人.
sentences.en: He was a very fine man, indeed I'll go further, he was the most courageous man I ever knew.

sentences.cn: 我不在意, 甚至还很高兴.
sentences.en: I didn't mind. Indeed, I was pleased.

sentences.cn: 我们甚至要问,它们为什麽会有质量 呢 ?
sentences.en: Indeed, why do they even have mass?

sentences.cn: 事实上更多的文件甚至会使搜索引擎更糟糕, 如果他没有很好的相关性.
sentences.en: Indeed, more documents can make a search engine worse, if it doesn't have good relevancy.

sentences.cn: 这种观点忽略了边际储蓄者, 甚至忽略了绝大部分的储蓄者.
sentences.en: The argument overlooks the marginal saver , and even , indeed, the great majority of savers.

sentences.cn: 我们与每一种哺乳动物 、 每一种动物, 甚至, 每一种生物体拥有共同的祖先.
sentences.en: We share a common ancestor with every mammal, with every animal; indeed, with every organism.

sentences.cn: 甚至,有些图示,让人迷惑不解.
sentences.en: Even some graphic demonstrations are quite puzzling indeed.

sentences.cn: 甚至, 就是有那么一些人,简单地通过对性事物的幻想,他们就能够达到性高潮.
sentences.en: Indeed, are some individuals who are able to reach orgasm simply by fantasizing about sexual matters.

sentences.cn: 他们抱怨,奥巴马的领导不起作用,甚至几乎觉察不到.
sentences.en: They complain that Mr Obama's leadership has been ineffective and indeed barely visible.

sentences.cn: 有几位力大的乘客~甚至想上前拖这中年男子下车,使人想起莫泊桑笔下[羊脂球]的情节.
sentences.en: A few stronger passenger were indeed trying to drag the man down the bus.

sentences.cn: 事实上, 最近的研究提出,黑猩猩甚至可以被划分在人类范畴当中.
sentences.en: Indeed, recent research suggests that they should be reclassified under the human genus.

sentences.cn: 我不认识他, 甚至连他的名字也没听说过.
sentences.en: I don't know him, indeed I have not as heard his name.

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, even before the steep climb in grain prices in 2008, the number of failing states was expanding.

Sentence.sentence: And there was indeed a personal link.

Sentence.sentence: He added that he had warned Mclaughlin that three preventable accidents in one year could lead to his discharge,as indeed it should.

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, Google, for which Leslie expresses admiration, is also his frequent whipping boy.

Sentence.sentence: Indeed, we are already hearing from some of them.
